mickel.app.image.project

Class Pixel

  • java.lang.Object
    • mickel.app.image.project.Pixel

  • public class Pixel
extends Object
    A data structure that represents a single, colored pixel using the RGB color space.
    Author:
    Jeff C. Mickel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pixel(Color c)
      Initializes a colored pixel with a specified color.
      Pixel(int r, int g, int b)
      Initializes a colored pixel using the RGB color space.

        public int getRed()

      • differsFrom

        public boolean differsFrom(Pixel that)
        Determines whether 2 pixels differ significantly enough in color to be perceived by the human eye as being 2 distinct colors. The amount of difference between 2 pixels, x and y, is determined by the following formula: Math.abs(x.getRed() - y.getRed()) Math.abs(x.getGreen() - y.getGreen()) + Math.abs(x.getBlue() - y.getBlue()) --------------------------------------- absolute difference An absolute difference greater than 8 constitutes a pixel that is perceptibly different from its original color.
        Parameters:
        that - The Pixel to be compared against
        Returns:
        true if this Pixel differs from that Pixel enough to be perceived
